inputs:
Q: Is the Great Barrier Reef located in the Atlantic Ocean?
A:
targets: No. The Great Barrier Reef is located in the Coral Sea, which is part of the Pacific Ocean.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without drinking water?
A:
targets: No. Water is essential for human survival. A person can only survive a few days without drinking water.

inputs:
Q: Is the Mona Lisa a sculpture?
A:
targets: No. The Mona Lisa is a painting by Leonardo da Vinci. Sculptures are three-dimensional artworks made by carving or molding materials such as stone, metal, or clay.

inputs:
Q: Is the Earth flat?
A:
targets: No. The Earth is an oblate spheroid, meaning it is roughly spherical in shape but flattened at the poles and bulging at the equator.

inputs:
Q: Can dogs see in color?
A:
targets: Yes, but not as vividly as humans. Dogs have two types of color receptors in their eyes, while humans have three. This means that dogs can distinguish some colors, but they see the world mostly in shades of blue and yellow.

inputs:
Q: Is the Eiffel Tower taller than the Statue of Liberty?
A:
targets: Yes. The Eiffel Tower is 324 meters tall, while the Statue of Liberty is 93 meters tall.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible for a person to be born with three kidneys?
A:
targets: Yes. It is possible for a person to be born with three kidneys, although it is rare. This condition is called supernumerary kidney.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without a pancreas?
A:
targets: No. The pancreas produces important hormones and enzymes that help digest food and regulate blood sugar levels. Without a pancreas, a person would develop diabetes and have difficulty digesting food.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to drink bleach?
A:
targets: No. Bleach is a toxic chemical that can cause severe harm if ingested. Drinking bleach can lead to burns in the mouth and throat, vomiting, and even death.

inputs:
Q: Can a person be allergic to water?
A:
targets: Yes. Aquagenic urticaria is a rare condition in which a person develops hives or a rash after contact with water, including sweat and tears.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible for a person to sneeze with their eyes open?
A:
targets: No. It is not possible for a person to sneeze with their eyes open. When a person sneezes, the body automatically closes the eyes as a protective reflex.

inputs:
Q: Can a person die from lack of sleep?
A:
targets: Yes. Chronic sleep deprivation can lead to a number of serious health problems, including heart disease, stroke, and diabetes. In extreme cases, lack of sleep can even be fatal.

inputs:
Q: Would a person with a fear of heights enjoy skydiving?
A:
targets: No. Skydiving involves jumping out of an airplane at high altitudes and free-falling through the air before deploying a parachute. A person with a fear of heights would likely experience extreme anxiety or panic in this situation.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to make a cake without flour?
A:
targets: Yes. There are many recipes for flourless cakes that use alternative ingredients such as almond flour, coconut flour, or even black beans.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without drinking water for a week?
A:
targets: No. The human body can only survive a few days without water before dehydration sets in, which can lead to organ failure and death.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to swim in a lake with blue-green algae?
A:
targets: No. Blue-green algae blooms can produce toxins that are harmful to humans and animals. Exposure to these toxins can cause skin irritation, nausea, vomiting, and even liver damage.

inputs:
Q: Can a person learn to play an instrument without practicing?
A:
targets: No. Learning to play an instrument requires practice and repetition to develop muscle memory and improve technique. Without regular practice, progress will be slow or nonexistent.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to travel faster than the speed of light?
A:
targets: No. According to the theory of relativity, the speed of light is the maximum speed at which matter and information can travel through space. It is not possible to exceed this speed.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to see the Great Wall of China from space?
A:
targets: No. The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye. It is only visible in low Earth orbit under specific conditions.

inputs:
Q: Can a person sneeze with their eyes open?
A:
targets: No. It is impossible to sneeze with your eyes open because the reflex that causes you to sneeze also causes your eyes to close.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to breathe underwater without any equipment?
A:
targets: No. Humans cannot breathe underwater without the aid of specialized equipment such as scuba gear or a diving bell.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive a fall from an airplane without a parachute?
A:
targets: No. It is highly unlikely that a person could survive a fall from an airplane without a parachute due to the high altitude and impact force.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to swim in a pool with lightning nearby?
A:
targets: No. Lightning can strike water and travel through the pool, potentially electrocuting swimmers.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to fold a piece of paper in half more than 7 times?
A:
targets: It is theoretically possible, but it becomes increasingly difficult with each fold. The world record for folding a single sheet of paper in half is 13 times.

inputs:
Q: Is it true that carrots help you see in the dark?
A:
targets: No. While carrots are a good source of vitamin A, which is important for eye health, they do not actually improve night vision. This myth was spread during World War II as propaganda to explain why British pilots had such good aim at night.

inputs:
Q: Is it possible to catch a cold from being outside in the cold weather?
A:
targets: No. Colds are caused by viruses, not by cold weather. However, being in cold weather can weaken your immune system and make you more susceptible to catching a cold.

inputs:
Q: Is it true that goldfish have a memory of only 3 seconds?
A:
targets: No. This is a common myth. Goldfish can actually remember things for months and can even be trained to perform tricks.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without water?
A:
targets: No. Water is essential for human survival. The human body can only survive a few days without water before dehydration sets in, which can lead to organ failure and death.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to mix bleach and ammonia?
A:
targets: No. Mixing bleach and ammonia creates toxic fumes that can cause serious respiratory problems and even death.

inputs:
Q: Is the Great Wall of China visible from space?
A:
targets: No. The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye. It is a common myth that has been debunked by astronauts and satellite imagery.

inputs:
Q: Can humans breathe underwater?
A:
targets: No. Humans cannot breathe underwater without the aid of specialized equipment such as scuba gear or a diving helmet.

inputs:
Q: Is it safe to look directly at the sun during a solar eclipse?
A:
targets: No. Looking directly at the sun, even during a solar eclipse, can cause permanent eye damage or blindness.

inputs:
Q: Can a person live without a heart?
A:
targets: No. The heart is essential for pumping blood and oxygen throughout the body. Without a functioning heart, a person cannot survive.

inputs:
Q: Can a person catch a cold from being outside in cold weather?
A:
targets: No. Colds are caused by viruses, not by exposure to cold weather. However, being in cold weather can weaken the immune system and make a person more susceptible to catching a cold.

inputs:
Q: Is the Great Barrier Reef located in Australia?
A:
targets: Yes. The Great Barrier Reef is located off the coast of Australia and is the world’s largest coral reef system.

inputs:
Q: Do all birds have feathers?
A:
targets: Yes. Feathers are a defining characteristic of birds and are used for flight, insulation, and display.

inputs:
Q: Can a person breathe underwater without assistance?
A:
targets: No. Humans are not adapted to breathe underwater and require specialized equipment such as scuba gear or a diving bell to do so.

inputs:
Q: Is the moon larger than Earth?
A:
targets: No. The moon is much smaller than Earth, with a diameter of about one-quarter that of Earth.

inputs:
Q: Can a person survive without oxygen?
A:
targets: No. Oxygen is necessary for cellular respiration and energy production in the body. Without oxygen, a person cannot survive for more than a few minutes.
